DataElement.preferredName: University of Washington Quality of Life Questionnaire Most Important Issues Past 7 Days Saliva 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of their saliva in the past seven days, using a 4 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: University of Washington Quality of Life Questionnaire Most Important Issues Past 7 Days Saliva
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to assess health-related quality of life in head and neck cancer patients._A question about a person's most important health issues._The most recent week, including today._The watery fluid in the mouth made by the salivary glands. Saliva moistens food to help digestion and it helps protect the mouth against infections.

ObjectClass.preferredName: University of Washington Quality of Life Scale, Version 4
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to assess health-related quality of life in head and neck cancer patients.

Concepts.longName: University of Washington Quality of Life Scale, Version 4
Concepts.definition: A questionnaire designed to assess health-related quality of life in head and neck cancer patients.

Property.preferredName: Most Important Issue Past Week Saliva
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about a person's most important health issues.:The most recent week, including today.:The watery fluid in the mouth made by the salivary glands. Saliva moistens food to help digestion and it helps protect the mouth against infections.

Concepts.definition: A question about a person's most important health issues.
The most recent week. May include the present day.
The watery fluid in the mouth made by the salivary glands. Saliva moistens food to help digestion and it helps protect the mouth against infections.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard of four responses from normal saliva consistency to no saliva.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has too little saliva.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has too little saliva.

PermissibleValues.value: I have less saliva than normal, but it is enough.
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Have Less Saliva Than Normal, but it is Enough

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Have Less Saliva Than Normal, but it is Enough
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has less, but enough, saliva.

Concepts.longName: Have Less Saliva Than Normal, but it is Enough
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has less, but enough, saliva.

PermissibleValues.value: My saliva is of normal consistency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has saliva of normal consistency.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has saliva of normal consistency.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has no saliva.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has no saliva.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
